cases.casename: Public Prosecutor v Lim Chai Heng[2019] SGHC 272
charges: For driving against the flow of traffic and causing a fatal accident, the accused person was charged under s 304A(a) of the Penal Code (Cap 224, 2008 Rev Ed) (“C”) for doing a rash act not amounting to culpable homicide.The Prosecution proceeded with this sole charge(“the offence”).

Four other charges relating to the hurt or grievous hurt caused by the accused person’s rash act which endangered the life or the personal safety of V1 to V4 (under ss 337(a) and 338(a) of the PC) were taken into consideration for the purposes of sentencing

cases.casename: Public Prosecutor v Parthiban Kanapathy[2019] SGHC 226
charges: importation of not less than 24.95g of diamorphine on 4 February 2012 at or about 2.29 pm, at Woodlands Checkpoint, Singapore.

cases.casename: Public Prosecutor v P Mageswaran and another appeal[2019] SGCA 22
charges: committing an act by which death was caused with the intention of causing the victim’s death – the most serious form of mens rea under s 299.

cases.casename: Pram Nair v Public Prosecutor[2017] SGCA 56
charges: rape under s 375(1)(a) of the Penal Code (Cap 224, 2008 Rev Ed), which is punishable under s 375(2)
sexual assault by penetration under s 376(2)(a), punishable under s 376(3)
sentence: Remains at 11 years and 19 days and the total number of strokes of caning is reduced from 12 to 10

cases.casename: Pham Duyen Quyen v Public Prosecutor[2017] SGCA 39
charges: under s 7 of the Misuse of Drugs Act (Cap 185, 2008 Rev Ed) (“MDA”)
sentence: affirmed the Judge’s decision on conviction and sentence and dismissed the appeal

cases.casename: Ng Soon Kim v Public Prosecutor[2019] SGHC 247
charges: voluntarily causing hurt by means of fire under s 324 of the Penal Code (Cap 224, 2008 Rev Ed) (“Penal Code”)
sentence: seven months’ imprisonment in its place
